Physically intervenes to stop Jerry from leaving through a dangerous exit, guiding him to a safer escape route.
Panics and flees from danger with Jerry, using quick thinking to escape unnoticed.
Shares a knowing look and silently agrees with Jerry on a plan to enter the old man's room, indicating trust and teamwork.
Disguises himself cleverly as an old man and cooperates with Jerry in a ruse to escape henchmen.
Aids Jerry in outsmarting pursuers and avoids confrontation by fleeing together.
Huddles with Jerry under the banquet table to avoid detection.
Tries to make themselves as small as possible under the table to avoid attention.
Cringes under the table during the violent attack, shows fear and caution.
Grabs Jerry and pulls him out from under the table to escape danger.
Reacts quickly to the danger by pulling Jerry out from under the table as Spats' body slides toward them.
Grabs Jerry to get out of danger quickly.
Works with Jerry to escape officials, uses disguises to protect themselves.
Plans to call Osgood for help, showing trust in an ally.
Encourages Jerry to phone Osgood with a humorous suggestion to elope despite social conventions.
Becomes deeply moved by Sugar's sad singing and interrupts the performance to kiss her, showing genuine affection and compassion.
Brushing a tear away from Sugar's cheek and offering comforting words ('None of that, Sugar - no guy is worth it.')
Immediately helping Jerry and escaping together despite being pursued, showing loyalty and teamwork
Stops Sugar from getting into the rear seat beside him, gently questioning her
Races across the planking toward the pier with Jerry, still in disguise
Quickly scrambles down the steps and races to meet Osgood, maintaining disguise and composure.
Calmly reacts to Sugar trying to get into the motorboat seat next to him, attempts to control the situation.
Admits to being a liar and a phony to Sugar, urging her to leave him for a better life.
Despite negative self-description, engages in an intimate, affectionate moment with Sugar.
Openly admits to being a liar and phony, warns Sugar not to want him.
Uses vivid, skillful metaphor to dissuade Sugar, showing persuasive communication.
Rips off his wig and reveals his male identity in a desperate attempt to be understood.
Faces a difficult social situation and struggles to find an effective way out, showing confusion and desperation.
